Package eHealth

Class DBController

java.lang.Object
eHealth.DBController
Direct Known Subclasses:
AppointmentsDB, DoctorDB, UserDB
abstract class DBController
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to establish a connection to the eHealth database.

The provided methods can be used to retrieve data from the database.

Author:
marin

  • Constructor Details

    • DBController

      DBController()

  • Method Details

    • connectToDB

      protected static java.sql.Connection connectToDB()

      Connecting to the eHealth database

      Creates a connection (session) to the eHealth embedded database.

      The returned connection object can be used to communicate with the database (execute queries)

      Returns:
      the connection object

    • getStringColumnFromDB

      protected java.lang.String getStringColumnFromDB​(java.lang.String column, java.lang.String table, java.lang.String whereCondition)

      Retrieving a String column from the database

      The caller of this method must provide the name of the table, the name of the column in that table and a where condition in order to retrieve the desired information.

      This method then uses this information to create a query which is then executed against the eHealth database.

      As a result, the caller of this method gets the String located in the desired column and at the desired row. If the query could not find any data, using the provided parameters, the method returns an empty String.

      Parameters:
      column - The desired column
      table - The desired table
      whereCondition - The condition to specify which row to retrieve
      Returns:
      The desired data as a String

    • getIntColomnFromDB

      protected int getIntColomnFromDB​(java.lang.String column, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String table)

      Retrieving a Integer column from the database

      The caller of this method must provide the name of the table, the name of the column in that table and a where condition in order to retrieve the desired information.

      This method then uses this information to create a query which is then executed against the eHealth database.

      As a result, the caller of this method gets the Integer located in the desired column and at the desired row. If the query could not find any data, using the provided parameters, the method returns a 0.

      Parameters:
      column - The desired column
      username - The user for whom the caller of this method wants to retrieve data
      table - The desired table
      Returns:
      The desired data as a Integer

    • getBigDecimalColomnFromDB

      protected java.math.BigDecimal getBigDecimalColomnFromDB​(java.lang.String column, java.lang.String table, java.lang.String whereCondition)

      Retrieving a BigDecimal column from the database

      The caller of this method must provide the name of the table, the name of the column in that table and a where condition in order to retrieve the desired information.

      This method then uses this information to create a query which is then executed against the eHealth database.

      As a result, the caller of this method gets the BigDecimal located in the desired column and at the desired row. If the query could not find any data, using the provided parameters, the method returns null.

      Parameters:
      column - The desired column
      table - The desired table
      whereCondition - The condition to specify which row to retrieve
      Returns:
      The desired data as a BigDecimal
      See Also:
      BigDecimal

    • resultSetToTableModel

      protected void resultSetToTableModel​(javax.swing.JTable table, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String whereCondition, int columnCount) throws java.sql.SQLException

      Populating a table with data retrieved from the database

      This method populates a empty table with data retrieved from the eHealth database.

      The parameters are used to specify which data from a database table should be presented in the UI-Table.

      Parameters:
      table - The table which must be populated with data
      tableName - The name of the table in the database
      whereCondition - The condition to specify which row to retrieve
      columnCount - The number of columns in the database table
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - If the query cannot be executed or no data is available

    • displayListOfAllDBEntries

      protected abstract void displayListOfAllDBEntries​(java.lang.String tableName)

      Displaying all entries of a database table on the console

      This method uses the provided table name to display all its data on the console.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the desired table
